query: find an actor whose last name is GUINESS

choices.summary: The actor table contains information about actors, including their names and the last time their records were updated. It is typically used for managing and referencing actor details in a database.

columns.name: actor_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each actor.

columns.name: first_name
columns.description: The first name of the actor.

columns.name: last_name
columns.description: The last name of the actor.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the actor's record.

choices.reason: Links actors to films, relevant for actor queries
choices.summary: The film_actor table represents the many-to-many relationship between actors and films, indicating which actors have appeared in which films. It is typically used to query actor filmographies or to analyze casting patterns in film productions.

columns.name: actor_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for each actor.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp indicating when the record was last updated.

choices.reason: Contains last names but not specifically actors
choices.summary: The customer table contains information about individuals who have made purchases at various stores. It is typically used for managing customer relationships and analyzing purchasing behavior.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each customer.

columns.name: store_id
columns.description: The identifier of the store where the customer made purchases.

columns.name: first_name
columns.description: The customer's first name.

columns.name: last_name
columns.description: The customer's last name.

columns.name: email
columns.description: The customer's email address for communication.

columns.name: address_id
columns.description: The identifier for the customer's address.

columns.name: active
columns.description: Indicates whether the customer is currently active (1 for active, 0 for inactive).

columns.name: create_date
columns.description: The date and time when the customer record was created.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The date and time when the customer record was last updated.

choices.reason: Contains last names but not specifically actors
choices.summary: The staff table contains information about employees in a retail context, including their contact details and store assignments. It is typically used for managing employee records and access within the organization.

columns.name: staff_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each staff member.

columns.name: first_name
columns.description: The first name of the staff member.

columns.name: last_name
columns.description: The last name of the staff member.

columns.name: address_id
columns.description: The identifier for the address associated with the staff member.

columns.name: picture
columns.description: A link or reference to the staff member's profile picture.

columns.name: email
columns.description: The email address of the staff member.

columns.name: store_id
columns.description: The identifier for the store where the staff member works.

columns.name: active
columns.description: Indicates whether the staff member is currently active (1) or inactive (0).

columns.name: username
columns.description: The username used by the staff member for system access.

columns.name: password
columns.description: The hashed password for the staff member's account.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the staff member's record.

choices.reason: Related to actors but does not contain names
choices.summary: The 'film' table catalogs movies available for rental, detailing their characteristics and features. Typical use cases include managing film inventory, rental transactions, and customer recommendations.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: title
columns.description: The title of the film.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A brief summary of the film's plot.

columns.name: release_year
columns.description: The year the film was released.

columns.name: language_id
columns.description: Identifier for the language in which the film is available.

columns.name: original_language_id
columns.description: Identifier for the film's original language, if different.

columns.name: rental_duration
columns.description: The number of days the film can be rented.

columns.name: rental_rate
columns.description: The cost to rent the film for a specified duration.

columns.name: length
columns.description: The total runtime of the film in minutes.

columns.name: replacement_cost
columns.description: The cost to replace the film if it is lost or damaged.

columns.name: rating
columns.description: The film's age rating.

columns.name: special_features
columns.description: Additional features available with the film, such as deleted scenes.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The date and time when the film record was last updated.
